edges.evidence: Decision to implement delete equipment directly resulted in completion of that feature as part of sprint outcome
Decision to implement remove roster members directly resulted in completion of that feature as part of sprint outcome
Team momentum from consistent efficiency gains (Phase 96: 50%, Phase 92: 33% time savings) enabled another sprint to complete at 50% time savings (15 min actual vs 30 min estimate)
Straightforward scope of delete operations (no complex validation logic required) contributed to rapid completion at 50% time savings
Team momentum may have enabled efficient decision-making and implementation planning for delete equipment feature
Team momentum may have enabled efficient decision-making and implementation planning for roster member removal feature
Team's sustained efficiency gains from Phase 91-104 (33-50% time savings per sprint) enabled tackling the navigation feature with confidence and rapid execution
Completed design system token migration and color standardization in Phase 104 provided consistent foundation for implementing navigation UI components in Phase 105
Navigation and discoverability was explicitly chosen as the sprint focus, directly driving the decision to implement Mobile More drawer, breadcrumb labels, and expanded nav sections
The decision to implement Mobile More drawer, breadcrumb segment labels, and expanded nav sections was directly executed, resulting in completion of all 3 files and 4 tasks
Sustained team momentum and efficiency gains enabled exceptional 90% time savings (15 min actual vs 1.5 hour estimate), accelerating the efficiency trend established in prior phases
Rapid completion of all navigation features (Mobile More drawer, breadcrumb labels, expanded sections) in minimal scope (3 files, 4 tasks) contributed directly to extreme time savings

Team momentum has accelerated dramatically: Phase 103 (33% savings) → Phase 104 (50% savings) → Phase 105 (90% savings) → Phase 106 (83% savings, 20 min actual). Sustained efficiency trend enables extreme time compression despite new feature scope.

Phase 104-105 established design system tokens, color standardization, and navigation patterns. This foundation enables team to confidently scope and execute content depth improvements without architectural rework.

Multiple layers of foundational work (design system, settings repairs, nav improvements) completed in prior phases reduced integration risk and enabled focus on higher-level content features (rich blocks, attendance stats, weather).

Decision to implement content depth improvements directly resulted in delivery of all four feature categories (rich block view, attendance stats, weather forecast, empty states) across 6 files with completion message confirming all deliverables.

High team momentum and proven execution velocity enabled confidence to tackle broader feature scope (4 content improvements) within compact 2-hour estimate, demonstrating team's ability to commit to ambitious work.
Sustained team momentum and efficiency gains from Phase 91-107 enabled the team to tackle verification and review tasks effectively within the 2-hour sprint window
Quality review backlog and verification testing requirements directly motivated and shaped the decision to conduct comprehensive verification and review quality testing as the sprint focus
Established accessibility and code quality standards from Phase 107 provided clear criteria and frameworks for conducting verification and review quality testing
The decision to conduct comprehensive verification and review quality testing directly resulted in successful completion of the testing activities
Efficient execution of the verification and review quality testing decision allowed completion in 1.5 hours (25% time savings), consistent with established efficiency trend
Accumulated team momentum from Phase 91-107 directly contributed to the continued efficiency gains, achieving 25% time savings in Phase 111
Team momentum from sustained efficiency gains (Phase 91-113a showing 25-33% time savings) enabled confident tooling-focused iteration; team completed Phase 113a in 33% under estimate
Observability instrumentation from Phase 112 and architectural foundation from Phase 113a provided stable base for focused tooling improvements without major refactoring
Code quality baseline and resolved security issues (PR #37) established confidence to focus on tooling optimization without addressing quality regressions
Focused tooling and config scope directly enabled efficient execution; achieved 25% time savings (0.75 actual vs 1 hour estimate), continuing efficiency momentum
Sustained team momentum (Phase 113a: 33% savings) directly enabled Phase 113b efficiency; continuing pattern of 25%+ time savings demonstrates compounding momentum effect
